channel.title: Jasher: Java Hashing Utility
channel.description:
This is a simple command-line program that will generate a MD5 or SHA1 hash of a file or string through command-line arguments. The source is included and of course there is no licensing or warranty. You're welcome to modify and redistribute. Source is available at the bottom.
Please comment.

item.title: Jasher: Java Hashing Utility
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

I tried to cut out all the crap from this thread. There was really nothing worth arguing about, we know he used the MessageDigest class, he never claimed it was a java implementation of MD5 or SHA1, the title of the thread is ‘hashing utility’. If you don’t want to say anything nice and instead simply argue, go someplace else, the forum is not the place for it.

Read full topic

item.title: Jasher: Java Hashing Utility
item.dc:creator: @PeeHPee PeeHPee
item.description:
@PeeHPee wrote:

[quote=“BAsh, post:8, topic:274177”][quote author=PeeHPee link=topic=362289.msg2753930#msg2753930 date=1240087099]

MessageDigest md = new MessageDigest("MD5");
md.update("lolhacker", 0, 9);
System.out.println("hash of lolhacker = " + new String(md.digest()));

[/quote]
Where do you parse the parameters and read the file? Exception handling? You don’t even have a class or method.[/quote]
he asked someone to show him an implementation of MD5 in 3 lines, not a class containing an implementation of MD5 in 3 lines, which you know as well as I do, can’t be done.

Read full topic

item.title: Jasher: Java Hashing Utility
item.dc:creator: @PeeHPee PeeHPee
item.description:
@PeeHPee wrote:

[quote=“unlimitedorb, post:6, topic:274177”][quote author=frank_ link=topic=362289.msg2753748#msg2753748 date=1240070505]
if the program is any more than 3 lines, you suck

protip: algorithms are not language specific
[/quote]

Once again frank_ fails to read.

yakman, you better hope that you were trolling. Otherwise, you are officially a frank_ flunky.

T4_ don’t listen to them. They don’t know what they’re talking about.

P.S. Show me an implementation of the MD5 or SHA-1 hashing algorithm, in Java, in 3 lines of reasonable length![/quote]

MessageDigest md = new MessageDigest("MD5");
md.update("lolhacker", 0, 9);
System.out.println("hash of lolhacker = " + new String(md.digest()));

Read full topic

item.title: Jasher: Java Hashing Utility
item.dc:creator: @yakman yakman
item.description:
@yakman wrote:

its a lot longer then 3 lines, in fact it spans several packages, and yet still manages to use java.security.MessageDigest

src/org/t4/jasher/util.MD5.java is an example

package org.t4.jasher.util;

import java.io.FileInputStream;
import java.io.FileNotFoundException;
import java.io.IOException;
import java.io.InputStream;
import java.io.UnsupportedEncodingException;
import java.security.DigestInputStream;
import java.security.MessageDigest;
import java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException;

public class MD5 {
	
	public static String generateHash(boolean isFile, String input) {
	
		if(!isFile) {
			MessageDigest md = null;
			byte[] md5hash = new byte[32];
			try { md = MessageDigest.getInstance("MD5"); } catch (NoSuchAlgorithmException e) { e.printStackTrace(); }
			try { md.update(input.getBytes("iso-8859-1"), 0, input.length()); } catch (UnsupportedEncodingException e) { e.printStackTrace(); }
			md5hash = md.digest();
			return Converter.convertToHex(md5hash);
		}
		
		else if(isFile) {
			MessageDigest md = null;
			InputStream inStream = null;
			byte[] md5hash = new byte[32];
			try { md = MessageDigest.getInstance("MD5"); } catch (NoSuchAlgorithmException e) { e.printStackTrace(); }
			try { inStream = new FileInputStream(input);} catch (FileNotFoundException e) { e.printStackTrace(); }
			try { inStream = new DigestInputStream(inStream, md); }
			finally { try { inStream.close(); } catch (IOException e) { e.printStackTrace(); } }
			md5hash = md.digest();
			return Converter.convertToHex(md5hash);
		}
		
		return "Fatal Error while hashing.";
		

	}
	
	
}

instead of
return “Fatal Error while hashing.”;

you could throw an exception, or at the very least return null

Read full topic
